jobs.title: Sr Solutions Architect - West
jobs.description:
As a Solutions Architect, you will serve as the product and technology adviser as well as a technical project manager with publishers and supply aggregators to ensure they receive maximum benefit from OpenX multi-screen ad technology platforms and services and to ensure they experience a seamless integration with their publishing and advertising environments.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Lead the onboarding of new clients from contract signing and remain as a technical adviser and project manager throughout the client lifecycle. Provide necessary documentation, project plans, and technical guidance to ensure seamless onboarding
- Interface externally with product, technical and business counterparts with our partners. You must know our products inside and out to instruct partners on optimal configurations
- As a product and technical expert, you will work closely with the partner leads to monitor our products' performance for key clients
- Scout proactively for growth opportunities, build a relationship as the trusted product and technical adviser, and deliver seamless operations between the partner and OpenX


**Required Qualifications**

- Expert troubleshooting skills in common web and mobile technologies, such as XML/XSLT, HTML, HTML5, SSL, JavaScript, Flash, and other internet/networking-related protocols
- Experience working cross-functionally and driving stakeholders to achieve a common goal
- Ability to interact effectively with technical counterparts as well as business teams on ad hoc basis
- At least 3 years of relevant work experience in a technical, client-facing role; or within an operations role requiring strong cross-functional program management


**Desired Qualifications**

- BS / BA  in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field
- Mobile expertise in either Objective-C, Swift, or Java
- Experience in video advertising technologies


**Desired Characteristics**

- Solid project management skills and high attention to detail
- Self-starter who thrives on innovation and driving ideas to completion
- Effective problem solver and communicator


**Company at a Glance**

OpenX is focused on unleashing the full economic potential of digital media companies. We do this by making digital advertising markets and technologies that are designed to deliver optimal value to publishers and advertisers on every ad served across all screens.

At OpenX, we have built a team that is uniquely experienced in designing and operating high-scale ad marketplaces, and we are constantly on the lookout for thoughtful, creative executors who are as fascinated as we are about finding new ways to apply a blend of market design, technical innovation, operational excellence, and empathetic partner service to the frontiers of digital advertising.

- Customer retention
- Customer spend growth by quarter

- Experience in growing a book of business and hitting/surpassing goals
- Excellent teamwork and communications skills – both inside and outside the company
- Highly organized, used to managing multiple projects to tight deadlines with great attention to detail
- Strong skills in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.

jobs.description:
The Account Director will play an integral role in maximizing regional revenue and driving partner relationships with supply and demand partners who leverage OpenX ad technology and services. This role is based in Sydney, and reports to head of APAC.

In the OpenX Partner Services team, we strive to exceed partner expectations through building, supporting and maintaining long-term indispensable relationships. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented environments. An Account Director will be responsible for delivering in the day-to-day execution; must be a high achiever who is able to execute business initiatives seamlessly to deliver – if not exceed – the financial objectives for our partners and OpenX.

Success in this role hinges on strong cross-functional global and regional relationships within OpenX, such as business development, marketplace quality, support, product, and finance teams. Stakeholders may also be located across various offices and time zones.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Oversees partnership success, business issue resolution, achieving KPIs, and maintaining high partner satisfaction -- works quickly to flag, mitigate, and/or resolve any obstacles with partners
- Ownership of revenue performance and engagement for regional partners, including monitoring daily performance fluctuations, and proactively implementing optimization recommendations
- Develop optimal revenue growth strategies and become a trusted advisor to our partners
- Work closely with ad operations, data, and business development teams to coordinate a holistic approach to revenue optimization, including providing guidance on ad server and demand stack settings
- Prepare, analyze, present data, often from various data sources and tools, to deliver partner QBRs, make recommendations, or ad hoc decisions with both external and internal stakeholders
- Coordinate with business operations and customer support teams to investigate and resolve issues
- Meet with internal teams and partners regularly to review performance and provide recommendations
- Provide in-market feedback to product and engineering in support of ongoing improvements to platform functionality, tools, and reporting interfaces
- Articulate opportunities or product gaps for innovation and incorporation into future projects/roadmap


**Required Qualifications**

- 7-10 years of analytical work experience in account management, digital advertising operations, or yield optimization for digital media companies
- A self-starter who is extremely proactive with a strong bias for action
- Is naturally inquisitive; desires to and thrives at continuously improving business processes/best practices
- Highly skilled in problem solving and business modeling skills with ability to form key, succinct insights and recommendations from comprehensive analyses.
- Excellent communication, presentation, and demonstrated leadership skills – has a persuasive influence, including ability to build rapport and trust, and can interact with all levels within partners’ businesses as well as within OpenX
- Solid project management skills -- is organized, detail-oriented, able to multitask, and drives cross-functional stakeholders to achieve a common goal
- Expert-level Excel, PowerPoint, Word skills; ability to independently perform lookups, pivots, and prepare presentations often using multiple and/or complex data sets
- Solid operational knowledge of Google Ad Manager features and functionality, and other ad platforms
- Strong relationship management skills and/or operational experience in working with multiple cross-functional teams who may also be located across various offices and time zones
- Willingness to travel internationally as needed (work is primarily based in Sydney)

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.description:
The Account Manager will play an integral role in maximizing revenue and driving partner relationships with publishers and supply aggregators who leverage OpenX ad technology and services.  Based in Japan, the role will report to the Managing Director, APAC.

In the OpenX Partner Services team, we strive to exceed partner expectations through building, supporting and maintaining long-term indispensable relationships. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented environments. AMs must be high achievers who are able to execute business initiatives seamlessly to deliver – if not exceed – the financial objectives for our partners and OpenX.

**Key Responsibilities**

- After initial partnership opportunities are determined, the AM will partner with a Solutions Architect to program manage all pre-launch activities necessary to integrate a partner’s business and ad platform with OpenX technology
- Post-launch, the AM oversees the partner relationship focusing on performance monitoring, such as daily performance fluctuations and proactively implementing optimization recommendations to improve overall yield
- Executing quantitative analyses and modeling to translate data into decisions is a key part of this role. One should be confident in preparing and presenting analytical insights and support on both a scheduled and ad-hoc basis
- AMs also forecast and have revenue goals against a set of partners based on maintaining current business and securing upsell opportunities
- Proactively identify, develop, and drive revenue growth opportunities while building relationships as a trusted advisor to partners
- The AM also works closely with business development team to identify additional sales opportunities. In some cases, additional internal teams, such as marketplace quality, support, product, and finance teams, will be accountable for delivering in the day-to-day execution. Stakeholders may also be located across various offices and time zones
- The AM should stay apprised of all issues and work quickly to flag, mitigate, and/or resolve any obstacles with partners
- The AM ultimately oversees partnership success, business issue resolution, achieving KPIs, and maintaining high partner satisfaction

** Required Qualifications**

- Ability to maintain ownership of revenue performance for assigned partners

jobs.description:
As the HR Generalist, you will report to the Vice President of Human Resources and provide generalist support in all functions of the HR Department. Specifically, the Generalist will support the administration of Open X’s human resource policies, procedures and programs. As an HR Generalist, you will coordinate and assist in the following functional areas: Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS), onboarding, benefits, training, development, compensation, employee relations, and departmental development. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other team members to develop, manage, and administer a variety of programs and activities covering multiple HR functions.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Assists with onboarding process. Conducts new hire orientations. Assists with drafting offer letters
- Responds to benefits questions and helps to coordinate annual open enrollment
- Primary point of contact for staff regarding general inquiries on payroll, benefit administration, and various HR related questions
- Works with hiring managers to draft and revise job descriptions
- Assists with the evaluation of positions to determine FLSA status, market pricing, and grading
- Assists with the analysis and evaluation of market data and internal data on the current and projected employee population to create salary grades and develop salary budgets and forecasts. - Collaborates with other HR functions as needed in the development of organizational HR strategies
- Prepares and reviews documentation associated with disciplinary action and employee performance and communication
- Helps to develop programs and processes

jobs.description:
Product Taxonomists are responsible for creating the thesauri and data structures that drive the categorization of content, consumer brands, and other players in the programmatic advertising ecosystem. They are also responsible for the documentation that allows OpenX’s partners categorize their websites, identify the end brands buying advertising, or the buying intermediaries (agencies), as well as keeping these definitions in sync for our partners, and the industry in general.

They perform data mining of OpenX’s catalogues to identify the best ways to gather and categorize publisher inventory. They create and maintain complex Boolean queries to classify items. They must be able to troubleshoot website categorization issues, tool and system issues. They must also be familiar with many types of metadata issues across OpenX’s different systems. They advocate for both data quality standards in OpenX as well as working with the industry standards agencies (iab).

We’re seeking Taxonomist as part of the OpenX product team in Pasadena CA, San Francisco, CA or New York City.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Develop browse structures to organize our content category, brands, and buyer taxonomies for our global advertising footprint.
- Coordinate cross-functional projects with a broad range of business and technical stakeholders.
- Analyze exchange metrics and buyer behavior data to make intelligent decisions on optimizing our taxonomies
- Help develop tools and update versioned taxonomies
- Work with external partners to make sure that these taxonomies are in sync


**Required Qualifications**

- Master’s degree in Library and Information Sciences, Knowledge Management, Information Management, or equivalent professional experience.
- Proven skills in data retrieval techniques.
- Experience working with catalog and classification systems and creation of thesauri.
- Excellent English language skills as well as proficiency in one or more languages (e.g. German, French, Japanese)

jobs.title: Scrum Master
jobs.description:
OpenX is a global leader in digital advertising technology. OpenX’s mission is to maximize advertising revenue for digital media companies on any connected screen. The company’s products include an ad server, a real-time bidding exchange and a supply-side platform. OpenX currently serves more than 800 publishers worldwide, including 65% of the comScore 100, with 200 million unique visitors and 100 billion ads auctioned per month through its exchange. OpenX has employees with offices in Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, New York, London, Kraków and Tokyo, and is backed by leading investors including Accel Partners, Index Ventures, Samsung Ventures and SAP Ventures. OpenX is ranked #7 on Forbes Top 100 America’s Most Promising Companies, #5 on Deloitte Technology Fast 500.


# Opportunity

The Scrum Master works with 2 to 3 teams at a time to deliver business value that helps meet OpenX’s corporate goals. The Scrum Master role is embedded in the teams but also acts as an extension of OpenX’s PMO team. This position is based at our Krakow office.

As the Scrum Master you are the process enabler. You are not afraid of raising issues and driving change to remove impediments and obstacles from your team. You support the Product Owner, and facilitate creativity. You participate in improving the team’s engineering practices and tools as needed. The qualified candidate utilizes strong leadership, has the ability to follow the leadership of others, practice effective communication, be adaptable to change, and has the capability to collaborate and share information with all levels of the team.

You will be responsible for coaching and mentoring Scrum and/or Kanban methodologies of various team members to ensure effective application of the iterative principles and applicable standards in alignment with agile principles. You will also be responsible for participating and/or helping provide relevant updates of product deliverables to OpenX's Scrum of Scrums and dashboards.


# Key Areas of Responsibility

- Organize and facilitate Scrum ceremonies including:

  - Daily Scrum
  - Sprint Planning
  - Sprint Review
  - Sprint Retrospective

- Support and educate the Product Owner, especially with respect to refinement and maintaining the product backlog.
- Support and educate the Team and Product Owner on effective user stories, and relative estimation.
- Participate and provide relevant updates of product deliverables to the Scrum of Scrums.
- Build a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis on healing and problem solving.
- Act as an extension of the organization’s PMO team.

jobs.description:
As a Security Engineer at OpenX, you will be a key member of the Information Security team, who will provide expertise in designing, building, and deploying security solutions in support of enterprise-level initiatives. Our Security Engineers work hands-on with our software engineers and operations teams to proactively identify and address security risks. Using your industry experience, you will assist in securing our environment and assets, monitor systems and networks for intrusions, resolve security incidents and develop company best practices. The ideal candidate will share our passion for engineering solutions to complex security problems, while minimizing friction and maximizing productivity.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Contributes to the planning, design, and engineering of security solutions across the enterprise
- Automates security controls to improve their effectiveness and efficiency
- Provides information security consultation and support for business and technology organizations within the company
- Become an integral member of our Computer Security Incident Response Team
- Assists developers in performing static and dynamic code analysis
- Keeps up to date on information security threats and countermeasures
- Supports product development by integrating security and compliance into SDLC
- Develops training materials to educate OpenX workforce members on best security practices


**Required Qualifications**

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or 4+ years of experience in Information Security
- Strong knowledge of commonly used exploits, attack methods, and defense strategies
- Strong understanding of networking and associated protocols
- Strong understanding of NextGen/Application-based firewalls
- Solid hands-on experience with Linux administration and security
- Experience in identifying, evaluating, and mitigating security and technology risk
- Strong knowledge of encryption tools and methodologies
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Ability to clearly communicate security issues and concepts to non-technical people


**Desired Characteristics**

- One or more of the following certifications: CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH, CIPP, CRISC, CGEIT, PCIP
- Experience supporting remote security infrastructure for a global company
- Experience with large scale automation tools (Puppet, Ansible, Salt, etc)
- Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
- Strong understanding of designing cloud-based security solutions and maintaining security on PaaS (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.)
- Strong knowledge of Intrusion Detection and Intrusion Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), authorization and authentication protocols and solutions (SSO, OAuth/OAuth2, SAML, OpenID, etc.), Next Generation Firewalls, Web Application Firewalls (WAF), SIEM, malware protection solutions, End-point Detection and Response (EDR) tools

- Lead the onboarding of new clients from contract signing and remain as a technical adviser and project manager throughout the client lifecycle. Provide necessary documentation, project plans, and technical guidance to ensure seamless onboarding
- Interface externally with product, technical and business counterparts with our partners. You must know our products inside and out to instruct partners on optimal configurations
- As a product and technical expert, you will work closely with the partner leads to monitor our products' performance for key clients
- Scout proactively for growth opportunities, build a relationship as the trusted product and technical adviser, and deliver seamless operations between the partner and OpenX


**Required Qualifications**

- Expert troubleshooting skills in common web and mobile technologies, such as XML/XSLT, HTML, HTML5, SSL, JavaScript, Flash, and other internet/networking-related protocols
- Experience working cross-functionally and driving stakeholders to achieve a common goal
- Ability to interact effectively with technical counterparts as well as business teams on ad hoc basis
- At least 3 years of relevant work experience in a technical, client-facing role; or within an operations role requiring strong cross-functional program management
- 

Pre-sales vetting of prospective clients

- 

Bilingual proficiency; fluent in both Japanese and English (speaking, reading, and written communication)

- TOEIC score level may be required for this role


**Desired Qualifications**

- BS / BA  in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field
- Mobile expertise in either Objective-C, Swift, or Java
- Experience in video advertising technologies


**Desired Characteristics**

- Solid project management skills and high attention to detail
- Self-starter who thrives on innovation and driving ideas to completion
- Effective problem solver and communicator
- Data analysis and good data-driven decision-making skills


**Company at a Glance**

OpenX is focused on unleashing the full economic potential of digital media companies. We do this by making digital advertising markets and technologies that are designed to deliver optimal value to publishers and advertisers on every ad served across all screens.

At OpenX, we have built a team that is uniquely experienced in designing and operating high-scale ad marketplaces, and we are constantly on the lookout for thoughtful, creative executors who are as fascinated as we are about finding new ways to apply a blend of market design, technical innovation, operational excellence, and empathetic partner service to the frontiers of digital advertising.

Our five company values form a solid bedrock serving to define us as a group and guide the company. Our values remind us that how we do things often matters as much as what we do.

We know our business flourishes or dies because of our customers.

We are all owners of OpenX. We stake our personal and professional reputations on the excellence of our work.

We are eager to teach and share what we know with others.

jobs.title: Sr Technical Writer
jobs.description:
The OpenX Product Documentation Team delivers high-quality content that enables our customers and partners to quickly succeed in using our products and realizing the value of our programmatic marketplaces.

We are looking for a reliable team player to add to the team. We need someone with great technical writing skills and a love for analysis and effective communication.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Gather content requirements, including business and product requirements from the Product Manager and from client-facing teams and user requirements from the User Experience team.  
- Write content that meets user and business requirements. Content includes product documentation, UI content (such as field labels, tooltips, page flow, and other on-screen content needs), internal communications about products, and other content in any form that serves the purpose of helping users succeed with our products.
- Develop internal communications and resources for both sprint-based releases and larger product launches.
- Take ownership of content for all assigned projects; responsibilities include facts gathering, quality assurance, file organization and management, writing, editing, proofreading, and final delivery of files. The right candidate will know when things need to get done, and will do them on time and keep the team manager informed.
- Work proactively with product owners, engineers, solutions architects, sales engineers, marketing, and others to gather information for documentation and launch communications.
- Identify or contribute to initiatives that improve the customer’s information experience. (Context-sensitive help, graphical presentation, interactive learning experiences, discoverability, and more.)
- Work with the big picture (content strategy and experience flow) as well as fine detail (refined and accurate content). Analyze and recommend process improvements continually to improve internal and external communication.


**Skills and Experience**

Must Have

- Mastery of fundamental technical writing disciplines and principles
- Expertise with at least one online help authoring tool (preferably Madcap Flare)
- Working knowledge of basic web authoring and styling, including HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
- Demonstrated excellence in technical writing with 3-5 available samples
- Bachelor's degree in relevant discipline, such as English, Communications, or Computer Science (or equivalent work experience) 

Highly Desirable

- 3+ years working as a technical writer in the computer software industry or other highly technical products
- Work experience in the online advertising tech industry
- Proficiency with Madcap Flare or other XML-based authoring tools
- Experience creating API/SDK documentation, such as conceptual overviews, code samples/use cases, and technical reference
- Additional related skills such as experience in graphic design, interactive design, and/or video tutorials
- Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment
- Good understanding of version control systems (such as Subversion and Git), issue tracking tools (such as JIRA), and wikis (Confluence)

jobs.title: Technical Data Analyst
jobs.description:
OpenX is looking for a Technical Data Analyst who will reshape the way the company uses data and will generate the insights derived to meet department-level and company-level OKR’s and KPI’s. You will work with a federated team of Technical Analyst embedded in finance, data, engineering and operations who will be responsible with leveling up OpenX’s use of data and insights to make business decisions.

The ideal person will need to be curious, smart, resourceful, deeply technical and business solutions minded. This is a new role at the company, so you will have the opportunity to be a key player in transforming OpenX into a data-driven company. This goes beyond using data for reporting and truly means driving business, product and operations decisions based on concrete, accurate and relevant data. This person will gain exposure to the entire business through frequent collaboration with the tech, finance and operations.


**Key Responsibilities**

- Will be a member of a collective of Analysts that will define and document business decisions across the organization.
- Analytics teams will require the new member to member with deep skillset to help bridge gaps:
  - Representatives in collective to define and document business definitions
  - Identify gaps in business reporting for the product team
  - Ensure federated analytics group are in sync
- Understand the departments OKRs and KPI’s, and build data insights to shape decision making
- Will pull data and conceptualize business problem and solutions
- Independently identify and pursue analytical opportunities that will yield actionable insights
- Drive scenario and sensitivity analyses to support the development of strategy and key initiatives
- Work cross functionally with other internal teams to support high-impact projects
- Present to senior management with analysis and recommendations


**Required Qualifications**

- 7 + years of experience as an Software Engineer or Technical Analyst
- Deep understanding of business requirements to allow departments to use data effectively that supports the company goals.
- Must have the ability to diagnose business questions, articulate business requirements, ability to conceptualizes data structures and ultimately provide team with data driven solutions.
- Superior analytical abilities, creativity, and the ability to form key, succinct insights and recommendations from a comprehensive analyses involving large amounts of data
- Solid knowledge of data modeling and some understanding of mechanics of data processing
- Must be proficient in SQL, python scripting; and, have a familiarity with JVM (Java, Scala, etc.) language for data retrieval and analysis.
- Comfortable with linux environments & git version control
- Experience in GCP analytics tooling or other cloud computing data analysis tools
  - Spark on DataProc
  - Big Query, RedShift, Athena
- Understanding of distributed warehouse architectures (Broadcast, Shuffle, Distribution key)
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization
- Bachelor’s degree required, with a major in Computer Science, Economics, or Math (Statistics)
- Get it done mentality and a sense of urgency
